availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
19
The Governor respited for twelve months a judgment of the Christian Circuit Court of $200, against L Kinstler for tipling
He pardoned Jno Shields convicted of Grand Larceny by the Fayette Circuit Court and sentenced to confinement in the Penitentiary for one year.
Also pardoned Wm Worlaw convicted of the crime of manslaughter by the Campbell Circuit Court and sentenced to five years confinement in the Penitentiary.

Decr 19
The Governor appointed Wm A. Piner a Notary Public for Campbell county until the end ofthe next session of the General Assembly
He commissioned H. Combs and Charles R. McQuire Justice of the Peace for Breathitt County in Districts Nos
